key_trends: AI agent automation replacing traditional software workflows
Enterprise demand for trustworthy AI systems with verification
Shift toward Software 3.0 paradigm with natural language programming

competitive_positioning.competitive_moat: Technical expertise in AI verification and open-source community building through Agent Contract and continuous-eval frameworks
competitive_positioning.differentiation: Focus on trustworthy, verifiable AI agents with natural language specification rather than just agent building tools
competitive_advantages: Open-source framework adoption creating ecosystem lock-in
Early mover in AI verification and trust infrastructure
competitive_vulnerabilities: Small team size against well-funded competitors
Dependence on rapidly evolving AI model capabilities

growth_indicators: Enterprise interest in AI agent verification
growth_bottlenecks: Limited team size for enterprise sales
Market education needed for Software 3.0 concept

key_risks: Rapid AI model evolution making current approach obsolete
Large tech companies building competing solutions
Market adoption slower than expected for AI agents

strengths: Addressing critical trust gap in AI deployment
Strong technical foundation with open-source traction
concerns: Very small team for ambitious vision
Highly competitive landscape with big tech players

next_steps: Scale team rapidly, especially enterprise sales
Build strategic partnerships with AI model providers
expansion_opportunities: Integration marketplace for verified AI agents
